body.p: The trunk of this tree would represent which requires to remain open. The split in the tree that leads to the two primary branches would represent the which requires to remain open. The smallest branches of the tree would represent which requires to remain open.

response.name: terminal_bronchioles
response.feedback: Incorrect. Terminal Bronchioles- are the less than 0.5mm in diameter and will lead to the alveolar sacs which are like the leaves of the tree.

response.name: bronchi
response.feedback: Incorrect. The right and left primary bronchi branch off of the trachea after the last C-shaped cartilage, just like the two primary branches of this tree.

response.name: trachea
response.feedback: Correct. The trachea, also known as the windpipe, is like the trunk of the tree that branches into smaller divisions.

response.name: hyaline_cartilage
response.feedback: Correct. There are 16-20 pieces of hyaline cartilage that prevent the largest division of the bronchial tree from closing

response.name: cartilage_plates
response.feedback: Incorrect. Cartilage plates are found in the bronchial tree and assist in keeping the airway open. The number of plates decreases as the size of the passageways decreases.

response.name: no_cartilage
response.feedback: Incorrect. If the passageways are small enough then no cartilage is required to keep them open.
